summary: Create Spellheim, a first-person 2.5D fantasy game set in the world of Niron, featuring deep customization, spellcasting, combat, biomes, creatures, NPCs, and music.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Fantasy wordmark logo reading “Spellheim”, medieval engraved style, dark ink on parchment background (spellheim-logo.dim_1024x256.png)
- Seamless parchment/aged leather UI panel texture, subtle ornamental corners (hud-panel-texture.dim_1024x1024.png)
- Set of 3 fantasy spell icons (projectile, area burst, shield) in a consistent ink/etched style on transparent background (spell-icons-set.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core app shell for Spellheim with a landing screen and an in-app navigation flow into the playable game scene.

Implement a playable first-person 2.5D game scene using Three.js via React Three Fiber, including player camera controls, a ground plane, collision boundaries, and a basic movement loop (WASD + mouse look).

Add an initial character customization UI that lets the player configure a character profile (at minimum: name, archetype/class, and 2–3 cosmetic selections) and apply it to the in-game HUD/profile state.
Implement a basic spellcasting system with at least three spells (e.g., projectile, area effect, defensive shield) including casting input, cooldowns, mana/energy resource, and simple visual effects.
Implement a minimal combat loop: spawn at least one hostile creature type with health, damage, simple AI (approach/attack), and death/respawn; enable the player to defeat it using spells.
Add biome support for the world of Niron: implement at least three biomes (visual palette + props/terrain variation) and a way to switch biomes (menu or portal) while keeping core gameplay intact.
Add NPC support: implement at least one non-hostile NPC with an interaction prompt and a simple dialogue UI (multi-line, next/close) that can be triggered in-game.
Add music support: include background music playback with controls (play/pause, volume) and ensure it continues appropriately across biome changes and scene transitions.

Establish a coherent visual theme for Spellheim (colors, typography, panels, buttons, HUD styling) that fits a fantasy game set in Niron, and apply it consistently across landing, customization, HUD, dialogue, and settings UI (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).

Add generated static image assets and use them in the UI: a Spellheim logo, a parchment-style HUD panel texture, and a set of spell icons. Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement backend persistence in the single Motoko actor for player save data (character profile, basic stats/progression, settings like audio volume) keyed to the authenticated Internet Identity principal when available.
